thread.title: Chronicle recommends: No on S.F. Prop. J
thread.title_full: Chronicle recommends: No on S.F. Prop. J - San Francisco Chronicle

author: San Francisco Chronicle
title: Chronicle recommends: No on S.F. Prop. J
text:
Photo: Michael Macor, The Chronicle The measure comes with too many flaws to support, and leaves the picking and choosing to city supervisors who may favor supporters in filling a yearly roster of 300 subsidy winners. The measure comes with too many flaws to support, and leaves the...
Along with home buyers and tenants, businesses are suffering from soaring rents and evictions in high-cost San Francisco. Proposition J offers the appealing idea of city subsidies to long-established stores, bars and restaurants facing skyrocketing leases. The measure comes with too many flaws to support, and leaves the picking and choosing to city supervisors who may favor supporters in filling a yearly roster of 300 subsidy winners. The measure comes with too many flaws to support, and leaves the...
